en-us.learning_promise:
**Learning Promise**
Your students will develop a collection of key skills they will use through their STEAM journey, such as working as a team, collaborating effectively, exploring inductive and deductive reasoning, generating ideas and communicating effectively.

lessons.lesson_description: Practice teamwork techniques by working through four engaging challenges.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: How well do you work as a team? Let’s find out. Build a Robotic Hand and use it to pass bricks from person to person. Don’t drop them!

step.title: Are you part of a team?

text.content:
Sports, music, dance, games... teams are found in all kinds of places.

Do you belong to a team? Does your team have a leader? What does your leader do?

reduced_palette.title: SPIKE Extra Ressources Pass the Brick

step.title: You have 5 minutes to build a Robotic Hand.

text.content:
**Challenge #1**: Pick a team leader and follow their directions. Work as fast as you can to build:
* 1 Robotic Hand

You will also need 6 LEGO bricks.

comments.comment: This stack will make the hand open once to start.
This stack will make the hand close when you’re pressing the Left Button on the Hub.
This stack will make the hand open when you release the Left Button on the Hub ...
... but it’s missing a block after this one. You have to add it!

text.content: Play the program by pressing the Left Button on the Hub to test that your robotic hand closes.

step.title: Take control of your Robotic Hand!

text.content: Program your hand to open and close.
Start with this program:

text.content:
**Challenge #2:** Pick a new team leader and follow their directions.

You’ll take turns using your Robotic Hand to move one brick at a time from point A to point B.
Adjust the number of seconds in the Wait for Seconds block to match the time you have to solve this challenge.

step.title: Stack as Many Bricks as You Can in 3 Minutes

text.content:
**Challenge #3:** It’s time for another new team leader.

Follow their directions and take turns using your Robotic Hand to stack one brick on top of another.

Watch out! If you make the tower fall, you’ll have to rebuild it on your own.

step.title: Move Bricks from One Place to Another

text.content:
**Challenge #4:** Now pair up with another team and pick one leader.

Team A: Take turns using your robotic hand to pick up a brick. Meet halfway and hand off the brick to the other team.

Team B: Take turns using only your robotic hand to grab the brick from the other team and deliver it to the assigned spot.
If the brick stacking challenge was easy, use this brick:
Otherwise, use this one:

Think about what you did well and what you could’ve done better.

Have you found new ways to improve your teamwork?

lessons.title: SPIKE Pass The Brick

lessons.lesson_description: Use LEGO bricks as a unique way to generate creative ideas.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Do you ever feel like you have a million ideas but can’t pick the best one?  Sure, you could use paper and a pencil to make notes, but here’s a more creative way to find your best idea.

text.content:
Here’s a fun way to cut a dog's hair!

Can you use the same process to make your mornings easier? More fun?
Think how you wake up, make and eat breakfast, and get to school. There’s gotta be something you wish was easier!
You’ll use it as a countdown clock.

step.title: You’ve got 3 minutes to generate ideas… go!

comments.comment: Press the Left Button on the Hub to start a 3 minute countdown
Press the Right Button on the Hub to start a 5 minute countdown.

text.content:
Think about what you’d like to improve about your mornings and how you could do it.

Play the program when you’re ready.
Press the left button on the Hub to activate a 3 minute countdown and on the right button for a 5 minute countdown.

step.title: Now, you have 5 minutes to take it further.

text.content: Make a few sketches and use the bricks to roughly build your idea.
Make sure to explore all of your ideas. Don’t evaluate anything. Ideas that seem useless at first could spark new ones.

step.title: Alright, you’ve got 5 minutes to share your ideas.

text.content:
Describe your ideas to your teammates. 

Ask each other clarifying (but not judgmental) questions.

step.title: You’ve got 5 minutes to discuss and choose best idea.

text.content:
Discuss, improve, and rule out ideas.

Agree on one idea you’ll explore further as a team.

step.title: Now you have 5 minutes to make a mock-up.

text.content:
Use the LEGO bricks to build your idea.

It doesn’t have to be fully working, but it should help you communicate your idea.

step.title: Ready? Present your idea in 3 minutes!

text.content:
Record a video explaining what you’ve been working on. 

Make sure to include your whole team, even the camera-shy ones!

What did you do well? Is there something you could’ve done better?

Use this method anytime you want to generate ideas and improve your creativity!

lessons.title: SPIKE Ideas The Lego Way

lessons.lesson_description: Define, customize, and communicate the use of a new “thing.”
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Do you think you’re creative? Game on! Figure out a use for this thing and convince your classmates it’s the coolest thing in the world.

text.content:
Do you know what it is? Bet you can find a use for it.

How can you improve the way you communicate new ideas?

reduced_palette.title: SPIKE Extra Ressources What is this

text.content: It looks like the best thing in the world!

text.content:
Play the program and see what it does.

Think about what this Thing could be.
Figure out something the thing could do. Change the program or the model to make it work… make sure you can explain your thinking!
Give a presentation that clearly communicates why this thing is so cool.

Think about what you did well and how you could improve for next time.

Can you feel your communication skills getting better?

lessons.title: SPIKE What Is This

lessons.lesson_description: Program a Rhino to start and stop before it hits something.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: This challenge is a little wild!  You’re gonna build and program a pet rhino. Can you make it move and stop before it bumps into something?

text.content:
What? It doesn’t always work as you expect?

How do you usually solve a new challenge?

reduced_palette.title: SPIKE Extra Ressources Going the Distance

text.content:
This build has two parts:

* > Rhino's Body
* > Rhino's Head

code_stack.title: SPIKE Extra resources Going Distance Step03-Program
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id="|T]t-NRo?(q!b3SJP]de" x="135" y="46"><next><block type="flippermove_setMovementPair" id="P.D_#=(AD2;KTP.FUuoP"><value name="PAIR"><shadow type="flippermove_movement-port-selector" id="-}kbB!@i.)V7$nMyr$++"><field name="field_flippermove_movement-port-selector">BA</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_movementSpeed" id="b=^jXc(NXfpa*$U{xLrF"><value name="SPEED"><shadow type="math_number" id="td1[QpEl`h=_LI1:(@nH"><field name="NUM">50</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_move" id="/L`09wZ(X(1]wlzsa23b"><field name="DIRECTION">forward</field><field name="UNIT">rotations</field><value name="VALUE"><shadow type="math_number" id="p[!?EfPK!M5`IPnKfn.D"><field name="NUM">10</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_stopMove" id="W9@KMmp[8rGm^ayjnI-P"></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Place a LEGO brick 1 meter (39 in.) from the Rhino's nose.

Play the program and see what happens.
The Rhino should run over the LEGO brick, showing no mercy!
Keeping the LEGO brick 1 meter (39 in.) from the Rhino's nose, adjust your program to make the Rhino stop as close to the brick as possible, without touching it.

How many wheel rotations will move the rhino as close as possible to the brick, without knocking it over?

Calculate how many times the circumference of the wheel fits into the distance to be traveled. Use this calculation to figure out the number of rotations you should enter as the block parameter.
d = 5.6 cm (or d = 2.2 in.)

Place the LEGO brick 120 cm (47 in.) from the Rhino's nose.

You have one chance to program the Rhino to stop as close to the brick as possible, without knocking it over.

Good luck!

step.title: Can you make the Rhino stop when its nose hits a ”wall?”

text.content:
Create 2 program stacks: 
* One without a sensor
* One using the Force Sensor (the Rhino’s nose) 

Play the program stacks separately and describe how your rhino’s reactions change.

The Force Sensor enables the rhino to detect objects when it touches them, regardless of the starting distance.

This program doesn’t use the Force Sensor:

code_stack.title: SPIKE Extra resources Going Distance Step06-Hint01
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><variables/><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id="|T]t-NRo?(q!b3SJP]de" x="31" y="46"><next><block type="flippermove_setMovementPair" id="P.D_#=(AD2;KTP.FUuoP"><value name="PAIR"><shadow type="flippermove_movement-port-selector" id="-}kbB!@i.)V7$nMyr$++"><field name="field_flippermove_movement-port-selector">BA</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_movementSpeed" id="b=^jXc(NXfpa*$U{xLrF"><value name="SPEED"><shadow type="math_number" id="td1[QpEl`h=_LI1:(@nH"><field name="NUM">50</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_move" id="/L`09wZ(X(1]wlzsa23b"><field name="DIRECTION">forward</field><value name="VALUE"><shadow type="math_number" id="p[!?EfPK!M5`IPnKfn.D"><field name="NUM">50</field></shadow></value><field name="UNIT">cm</field><next><block type="flippermove_stopMove" id="B%Q[8dXRm=~aG+ZQ?I.Z"/></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content: This program uses the Force Sensor:

code_stack.title: SPIKE Extra resources Going Distance Step06-Hint02
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id="|T]t-NRo?(q!b3SJP]de" x="-22" y="25"><next><block type="flippermove_setMovementPair" id="P.D_#=(AD2;KTP.FUuoP"><value name="PAIR"><shadow type="flippermove_movement-port-selector" id="-}kbB!@i.)V7$nMyr$++"><field name="field_flippermove_movement-port-selector">BA</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_movementSpeed" id="b=^jXc(NXfpa*$U{xLrF"><value name="SPEED"><shadow type="math_number" id="XHC?WyJ@bWBb.rLN@s;,"><field name="NUM">50</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermove_startSteer" id="0G~Zhr!*%hb(hbv}kN+L"><value name="STEERING"><shadow type="flippermove_rotation-wheel" id="GiajV7{h]~]YcTtskeXm"><field name="field_flippermove_rotation-wheel">0</field></shadow></value><next><block type="control_wait_until" id="}12UDz}yUXC-fTm@Sn}-"><value name="CONDITION"><block type="flippersensors_isPressed" id="f*Y@)1d)D?snnK2$90L7"><field name="OPTION">pressed</field><value name="PORT"><shadow type="flippersensors_force-sensor-selector" id="]a*FuIC/k@$G2?K=vu|["><field name="field_flippersensors_force-sensor-selector">C</field></shadow></value></block></value><next><block type="flippermove_stopMove" id="W9@KMmp[8rGm^ayjnI-P"></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
What did you do well? Is there anything you could’ve done better?

Good to know you've solved that challenge!

lessons.title: SPIKE Going The Distance

lessons.lesson_description: Collaborate to build a fun tabletop challenge and score as many goals as possible.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Build a fun tabletop challenge, then collaborate with your teammates to make passes and score goals. May the best collaborators win!

text.content:
Wait a minute, what’s collaboration anyway?

Do you know any tricks for collaborating to win?

Follow these building instructions to make:
* 1 Goal
* 1 Robot Player
* 1 Hand Player
* 1 Disk

You’ll also need these 6 LEGO bricks.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Extra resources Goal Step03-Program

text.content:
Play the program. Did you score a goal?

Adjust the program parameters to improve your accuracy.

step.title: 1 minute to score as many goals as possible!

text.content:
**Challenge #1:** Here are the rules: 

* Place everything in random positions.
* You must pass the disk at least once before scoring a goal.
* You have 1 minute to rack up as many goals as you can!

step.title: Collaborate to create your own challenge!

text.content:
**Challenge #2:** Use bricks and other things to build a new challenge. 

* Create your own rules. 
* Make sure to include everybody's ideas!
* Challenge others to a match.

What did you do well? Is there something you could’ve done better?

Can you share some tips for awesome collaboration?

lessons.title: SPIKE Goal

en-us.title: SPIKE Supplementary Lessons
en-us.unit_plan_description: Get ready to start your exciting learning journey! You'll have to rely on your communication and collaboration skills as you work on these lessons and projects.
en-us.unit_plan_subtitle: Simple and fun lessons to practice your building and coding skills!
